title: Outlier Effect on Data
question_text: Which of the following values is LEAST affected if an extremely low outlier is added to a large set of data?
correct_answer: The correct answer in this case is Choice 'C'.
solution:
The IQR, interquartile range, is equal to $Q3 - Q1$.

Therefore, the value of the IQR will not change. The IQR is a resistant measure of spread as $Q3$ and $Q1$ do not take outliers into consideration.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because when a low outlier is added to the set, the minimum value will change.

Choice 'B' is incorrect because the mean is non-resistant to extreme values.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because the range is equal to the maximum value minus the minimum value which indicates the range will change when a low outlier is added to the set. The range is a non-resistant measure of spread.

Choice 'E' is incorrect as the standard deviation takes into account how far all the individual values vary from the mean. Therefore, when a low outlier is added to the set, the standard deviation will increase. The standard deviation is also a non-resistant measure of spread.
